channel.title: What would I be better off with?
channel.description: Alright, my graduation is coming up and I'm expecting enough money to buy a 360. However, I'm not entirely sure what I should do for Live. Should I get the Wireless N adapter, or should I use a powerline system (something such as [url=http://www.belkin.com/IWCatSectionView.process?Section_Id=206578]this[/url])?

item.title: What would I be better off with?
item.dc:creator: @rip4d rip4d
item.description:
@rip4d wrote:

[quote=“ChaosPkers, post:23, topic:343289”]get the belkin wireless adapter. i used it for a while and it got the job done i suppose. than i hard wired and i rape anally connection wise :D[/quote]Well I have a Belkin wireless N+ Adapter and I’m trying to use it but no luck (I just got the XBox Elite spring bundle for graduation ^^)

Read full topic
item.source: What would I be better off with?

item.title: What would I be better off with?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

marcbob:

Xbox 360 is way better than Ps3. Who cares paying 7$ a month and + obama will probably pay it for you now if your that broke where 7$ matters.

I care about $7/month when I play my PS3 a few hours a month at most. If you purchase a game for $50 or more, you shouldn’t have to pay to play it online. Not to mention how inferior xbox is to ps3, and how many xboxes die every day.

And the president of the USA is going to pay $7/month for me to play online? That makes no sense at all.

Read full topic
item.source: What would I be better off with?

Xbox 360 is way better than Ps3. Who cares paying 7$ a month and + obama will probably pay it for you now if your that broke where 7$ matters. I use wireless and ive never had a problem with it and its usefull because alot of my friends have wireless rowters so if I take my xbox to their house i can use their wi-fi

item.title: What would I be better off with?
item.dc:creator: @rip4d rip4d
item.description:
@rip4d wrote:

[quote="`Aaron, post:18, topic:343289"][quote author=rip4d link=topic=439681.msg3232379#msg3232379 date=1276195850]

This topic isn’t about PS3 he is wondering which he would be better off with, i suggest you all get on topic.

Rip, i use a Wireless adapter, but how is your internet connection? if it’s not very good i would use an Ethernet cable.

[/quote]I’d say my wireless internet connection is good. I use this, which has really far range and great connection. I even added a parabola of paper and aluminum foil to enhance my connection. I do believe it’s dual-band too, so I would be able to use 5GHz with an XBox.

I would use wireless then, it’s less of a hassle but it will have less power.[/quote]Alright, as soon as I get money I’ll try to get it all Considering I can get host fairly often on Wii, 5GHz on an XBox should work enough for me.

Thanks guys This can be locked now if a mod feels like it :3

Read full topic

[/quote]I’d say my wireless internet connection is good. I use this, which has really far range and great connection. I even added a parabola of paper and aluminum foil to enhance my connection. I do believe it’s dual-band too, so I would be able to use 5GHz with an XBox.[/quote]

I would use wireless then, it’s less of a hassle but it will have less power.

item.title: What would I be better off with?
item.dc:creator: @rip4d rip4d
item.description:
@rip4d wrote:

I’m really only choosing XBox over PS3 because only about 6 of my friends have it, where as maybe 40 have XBox.

@Chassy I don’t think my parents would let me move the router mainly because my mom’s desktop is wired to it. There’s a good 30 - 40 feet and another floor between my room and the router, so ethernet cables aren’t exactly an option for me. However, I still get 4 bars connection using my wireless adapter, and its on 2.4GHz, where as an XBox N adapter can use 5GHz if I remember correctly. I was just wondering which I would be better off with speed-wise.

Read full topic
item.source: What would I be better off with?

item.title: What would I be better off with?
item.dc:creator: @si_force Si Force
item.description:
@si_force wrote:

I’d honestly go for a PS3 as well as there’s no online monthly fee. There’s nothing that special about the Xbox that would convince me to pay an extra $60 (i think it is that much) just for the sake of online access.

Read full topic
item.source: What would I be better off with?

item.title: What would I be better off with?
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

Aren’t both of those at least $100+?

If they are both for connecting to Xbox Live, I just use an ethernet cable. You can buy a longer ethernet cable than what the default one is for like 10 dollars, and HD cables for like 30$. I am assuming your router isn’t near your Xbox though, but I would see if you can move it before spending that kind of money.

Read full topic
item.source: What would I be better off with?

item.title: What would I be better off with?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Or you could get a PS3 and have wireless built in, and not have to pay monthly for online play.
